title: Implement timbers generate command
description:
Add `timbers generate` as a composable LLM primitive.

## Usage
```bash
# Simple completion
echo 'Explain this' | timbers generate --model haiku

# With explicit provider
timbers generate 'Summarize' --provider anthropic --model claude-3-haiku

# Structured output
timbers generate 'List items' --model haiku --json
```

## Flags
- `--model, -m` - Model name (haiku, sonnet, gpt-4o-mini, etc.)
- `--provider, -p` - Provider (anthropic, openai, google) - inferred if omitted
- `--system` - System prompt
- `--json` - Request JSON output
- `--input, -i` - Input file (default: stdin)

## Agent DX
- Reads from stdin (pipeable)
- Writes to stdout
- Supports --json for structured responses
- Clear error messages with recovery hints

title: Add multi-provider LLM client library
description:
Evaluate and add a Go library for multi-provider LLM support.

## Candidates
- bellman (github.com/modfin/bellman) - Clean interfaces, supports Anthropic/OpenAI/Gemini/Ollama
- gollm (github.com/teilomillet/gollm) - Fluent builder, prompt optimization features

## Requirements
- Support Anthropic (Claude), OpenAI, Google (Gemini)
- Simple completion API (no chains/RAG needed)
- Structured output (JSON) support
- API key configuration via env vars

## Acceptance
- Library added to go.mod
- Basic wrapper in internal/llm/ with provider-agnostic interface

Add multi-provider LLM support to enable intelligent entry generation.

## Goals
- Add `timbers generate` as a composable LLM primitive

- Use bellman or gollm for multi-provider support
- `generate` is the low-level primitive (stdin/stdout, --model, --json)
- `catchup` is the high-level workflow (groups commits, calls generate internally)
- Keep existing `log --batch` for mechanical no-LLM grouping

title: Implement timbers catchup command
description:
Add `timbers catchup` for LLM-powered historical documentation.

## Usage
```bash
# Catch up entire repo with cheap model
timbers catchup --model haiku

# Preview without writing
timbers catchup --model haiku --dry-run

# Specific range
timbers catchup --range abc123..def456 --model haiku

# Parallel processing
timbers catchup --model haiku --parallel 10
```

## Flags
- `--model, -m` - Model for generation (default: haiku)
- `--batch-size` - Commits per LLM call (default: 20)
- `--range` - Specific commit range
- `--dry-run` - Preview entries without writing
- `--parallel` - Concurrent LLM calls (default: 5)
- `--json` - Output results as JSON

## Behavior
1. Group pending commits (by work-item or day, reuse existing logic)
2. For each group, gather context (commits, diffs, beads if available)
3. Call LLM to generate what/why/how
4. Write entries to git notes

## Context Gathering
- Commit messages and bodies
- Diffstat (already captured)
- Work-item references (beads, jira, etc.)
- Optionally: actual diffs for small groups
